intro: Alternanthera flavescens, commonly known as the goldenAlternanthera, is a herbaceous plant native to South America. It is characterized by its striking, bright yellow to orange-red foliage that changes with the seasons. The plant typically grows in moist, shady environments and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. It produces small, inconspicuous greenish-white flowers that are clustered in spikes. The plant is popular in horticulture for its vibrant foliage and is often used in water gardens and as a decorative plant.
